title: Facebook: How to Post Multiple Photos on Windows, Mac, iOS, and Android

steps.title: Open the Facebook app and log in, if you're not logged in already.
steps.content: Open the Facebook app and log in, if you're not logged in already. The Facebook app has a blue icon with a white "f". If you're not already logged in, log in with your Facebook email and password.

steps.title: Go to your profile.
steps.content: Go to your profile. Tap on your profile picture next to the "What's on your mind?" text at the top of the screen. You can also access your profile by tapping the menu button and tapping your name at the top of the screen.

steps.title: Go to your photos.
steps.content: Go to your photos. Tap on the Photos tab, which is located directly above your personal details, and you will be brought to your Photos page.

steps.title: Tap on the Albums button.
steps.content: Tap on the Albums button. This button is under the "Your photos and videos" heading after the Photos button. All of your Facebook photo albums will appear here.

steps.title: Click the Create album button.
steps.content: Click the Create album button. This will bring you to the album creation screen.

steps.title: Enter an album name and create the album.
steps.content: Enter an album name and create the album. Tap Save (on iOS) or Create (on Android) in the upper-right corner to create the album. After making an album, it will appear in your Albums tab, and will be empty.

steps.title: Tap Add photos/videos in your empty album.
steps.content: Tap Add photos/videos in your empty album. This will open up a pop-up where you can select photos to add to your album. Tap on each photo you want to add to the album.

steps.title: Add the photos.
steps.content: Add the photos. Tap the Done button (on iOS) or Next button (on Android) in the upper-right corner to add the photos to the album.

steps.title: Add captions, tags, or locations to your photos, if desired.
steps.content: Add captions, tags, or locations to your photos, if desired. Tap on one of the photos in your draft post to open the screen where you can add captions, tags, or locations. When you're done, tap the Done button in the upper-right corner. When you add photos to an album on mobile, they are also posted as a post to your profile. You can add text to your post by tapping "Say something about these photos..." but this is optional.

steps.title: Create your album.
steps.content: Create your album. Tap Upload (on iOS) or Post (on Android) in the upper-right corner to add the photos to your album. Your album will be added to your Facebook photos, and you can view it by going to the Albums tab of the Photos section of your profile.

steps.title: Open the Facebook app and log in, if you're not logged in already.
steps.content: Open the Facebook app and log in, if you're not logged in already. The Facebook app has a blue icon with a white "f". If you're not already logged in, log in with your Facebook email and password.

steps.title: Start creating a post.
steps.content: Start creating a post. On almost all pages on Facebook, you can make a new post. There’s a post box located at the top of the News Feed, on your Timeline, and on your friends’ pages. Locate this post box to start making a post.

steps.title: Tap Photo/video under the post box.
steps.content: Tap Photo/video under the post box. It's the first option under the post box. You can also tap the green icon of a stack of photos next to the "What's on your mind?" text before you tap into the post box.

steps.title: Tap on each photo you want to add to the post.
steps.content: Tap on each photo you want to add to the post. On iOS, you can simply tap each photo you want to add to the post. On Android, tap the Select multiple button in the upper-right corner, then tap on each photo you want to add. Tap the Done button (on iOS) or Next button (on Android) in the upper-right corner to add the photos to the post.

steps.title: Add captions, tags, or locations to your photos, if desired.
steps.content: Add captions, tags, or locations to your photos, if desired. Tap on one of the photos in your draft post to open the screen where you can add captions, tags, or locations. When you're done, tap the Done button in the upper-right corner.

steps.title: Click Post to upload your photos to a post.
steps.content: Click Post to upload your photos to a post. You can view your post in your profile's Posts tab. It should also appear at the top of your News Feed once you post it, but it'll get pushed down the feed as your friends and followed pages make posts.

steps.title: Go to Facebook and log in, if you're not logged in already.
steps.content: Go to Facebook and log in, if you're not logged in already. Visit Facebook’s home page from any web browser. Use your Facebook account and password to log in. The login fields are on the upper right corner of the page. Click the “Log in” button to proceed.

steps.title: Go to your profile.
steps.content: Go to your profile. Click on your name in the left-hand sidebar, or your profile picture in the upper-right corner. You will be brought to your Timeline, or wall.

steps.title: Go to your photos.
steps.content: Go to your photos. Click on the Photos tab right below your cover photo, and you will be brought to your Photos page.

steps.title: Click on the Albums tab.
steps.content: Click on the Albums tab. All of your Facebook photo albums will appear here.

steps.title: Click the Create album button.
steps.content: Click the Create album button. This will bring you to the album creation screen. Enter a name for your album in the field that says "Album Name."

steps.title: Click Upload Photos or Videos.
steps.content: Click Upload Photos or Videos . This button is in the left-hand sidebar.

steps.title: Select your photos.
steps.content: Select your photos. To select multiple photos to be uploaded at the same time, hold the CTRL key (or CMD key for Mac) as you click on each photo to upload.

steps.title: Add the photos.
steps.content: Add the photos. Click on the “Open” button on the lower right corner of the small window, and the selected photos will start uploading to Facebook under a new album. Once you add the photos to the album, they will begin to upload. If you're adding a lot of pictures at once, it may take a while for the photos to upload.

steps.title: Add descriptions, tags, or locations to your photos, if desired.
steps.content: Add descriptions, tags, or locations to your photos, if desired. Once the photos have uploaded to the new album, they will be displayed as thumbnails. You can add descriptions, tag other users, or add a location to your photos if you want. This step is optional, however.

steps.title: Click Post in the lower-left to create your album.
steps.content: Click Post in the lower-left to create your album. Your album will be added to your Facebook photos, and you can view it by going to the Albums tab of the Photos section of your profile.
